PageTitle: c-bsr interval (VPN instance PIM view/PIM view of a public network instance)
FuncDef:
The c-bsr interval command sets the interval at which the bootstrap router (BSR) sends bootstrap messages.
The undo c-bsr interval command restores the default setting. The c-bsr interval command sets the interval at which the bootstrap router (BSR) sends bootstrap messages. The undo c-bsr interval command restores the default setting. By default, the interval at which the BSR sends bootstrap messages is 60 seconds.
ParentView: VPN instance PIM view,PIM view of a public network instance

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval at which the C-BSR sends bootstrap messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 107374177, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
To maintain the BSR status, a BSR dynamically elected among candidate-bootstrap routers (C-BSRs) needs to periodically send bootstrap messages carrying the BSR IP address and the rendezvous point (RP)-set information to the C-BSRs. To set the interval (called BS_interval) at which the BSR sends bootstrap messages, run the c-bsr interval command.
Only the BSR sends bootstrap messages, and each C-BSR starts a timer and waits to receive bootstrap messages from the BSR before the timer times out. The timeout period (called holdtime) of the timer can be configured using the c-bsr holdtime command.
